page.title: 15The Old Clergy House
page.content:
The Old Clergy House,Alfriston is described as a 'living museum'. Its only exhibit is a history of the building. It is one of a number of timber framed buildings in the area but unlike others there have been few alterations to its structure.
Inside the Old Clergy House you can see what the house was like when it was constructed. One part of the wattle and daub has been exposed to show how the house was made.
The house was built in 1350. Although called the Clergy House it was rented out by the church to tenants. It was the first property bought by the National Trust,in 1896,and today about 28,000 people visit it each year of which 45% are National Trust members.
